title: Former NRL player Erickson Aukafolau in critical condition with serious head injuries in Indonesia
text:
Desperate family and friends are trying to bring a former NRL player home after he was seriously injured on holiday in Bali, Indonesia.

Erickson 'Eric' Aukafolau, who played for the Parramatta Eels before a knee injury derailed his career in 2015, was on a trip with his brother and friends last week.

He was hurt in an accident and needs to be medically transferred home to Australia for treatment, family friend Kristy Richards said.

Erickson 'Eric' Aukafolau (pictured right with close friends) was seriously injured in an accident while holidaying in Indonesia

Mr Aukafolau (left) played for the Parramatta Eels before a knee injury derailed his career in 2015. He is pictured with his sister Luana (back) and brother Dane (right) who now plays for the Eels

'Eric has suffered serious head trauma and has had life saving emergency surgery, this being the first of many surgeries needed,' she said.

'We are extremely worried and concerned as the further treatment and surgery Eric is requiring is not a option over in Indonesia and we need to get him back to Australia.

'We love him and need him home.'

Ms Richards said the medical evacuation would cost tens of thousands of dollars and appealed for help online.

A GoFundMe page has raised more than $60,000 in less than two days since it was created on Sunday.

Mr Aukafolau was hurt in an accident and needs to be medevaced home to Australia for treatment, family friends said

His family and friends said the medical evacuation for Mr Aukafolau (far right) would cost tens of thousands of dollars and appealed for help online

Two of his friends are also running a fundraiser workout at his gym in Merrylands, western Sydney, on Sunday.

Mr Aukafolau was on Parramatta's under-20s National Youth Competition squad in 2014 but blew out his knee at a match against Manly in March that year.

Just a few months after the ACL tear he lost his mother Aivi, prompting a condolence tweet from the Eels.

Mr Aukafolau was named to the 2015 squad but ended his career after that season due to persistent leg injuries.

The family is well known in Sydney's rugby league circles and Eric's younger brothers Dane, 22, and Noel play for Parramatta's under-20s team.

Noel was selected for the 2017 New South Wales under-18s State of Origin team.

Mr Aukafolau (third from left) and his family are well known in Sydney's rugby league circles and Eric's younger brothers Dane, 22, and Noel play for Parramatta's under-20s team
description: Erickson 'Eric' Aukafolau, an ex-Parramatta Eels player, had an accident while on holiday with friends in Indonesia and suffered serious head injuries that need surgery in Australia.
authors: Nic White For Daily Mail Australia
